publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1127 Tommy Sheridan: Glasgow Schools PFI-That the Parliament notes with concern the article in the Sunday Herald of 9 July by Torcuil Crichton suggesting that the PFI deal for Glasgow schools is likely to cost taxpayers £34 million more than if the schools were built and refurbished in the public sector and calls for a full investigation by Audit Scotland and the local government ombudsman.
S1M-1127 Glasgow Schools PFI (lodged on 24 August 2000) Michael Russell*, Christine Grahame*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*

S1M-1127 Tommy Sheridan: Glasgow Schools PFI-That the Parliament notes with concern the article in the Sunday Herald of 9 July by Torcuil Crichton suggesting that the PFI deal for Glasgow schools is likely to cost taxpayers £34 million more than if the schools were built and refurbished in the public sector and calls for a full investigation by Audit Scotland and the local government ombudsman. Supported by: Michael Russell, Christine Grahame, Dorothy-Grace Elder
S1M-1127 Glasgow Schools PFI (lodged on 24 August 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-1127 Glasgow Schools PFI (lodged on 24 August 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1127 Glasgow Schools PFI (lodged on 24 August 2000) Alex Neil*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-1127 Glasgow Schools PFI (lodged on 24 August 2000) Shona Robison*

S1M-1127 Tommy Sheridan: Glasgow Schools PFI-That the Parliament notes with concern the article in the Sunday Herald of 9 July by Torcuil Crichton suggesting that the PFI deal for Glasgow schools is likely to cost taxpayers £34 million more than if the schools were built and refurbished in the public sector and calls for a full investigation by Audit Scotland and the local government ombudsman. Supported by: Michael Russell, Christine Grahame, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Andrew Wilson, Linda Fabiani, Alex Neil, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Shona Robison, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-1127 Glasgow Schools PFI (lodged on 24 August 2000) Michael Matheson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Gil Paterson*
